intro: Guenthera repanda subsp. dertosensis, commonly known as the Dertos guenthera, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the semi-arid regions of southern Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a low, spreading growth habit with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it blooms during the dry season. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
